chrome.debugger

Top-Level Variables
debugger: ChromeDebugger
Classes
ChromeDebugger
Debuggee
TargetInfo

The chrome.debugger API serves as an alternate transport for Chrome's [remote debugging protocol](http://code.google.com/chrome/devtools/docs/remote-debugging.html). Use chrome.debugger to attach to one or more tabs to instrument network interaction, debug JavaScript, mutate the DOM and CSS, etc. Use the Debuggee tabId to target tabs with sendCommand and route events by tabId from onEvent callbacks.

Top-Level Variables

static final ChromeDebugger debugger

Accessor for the chrome.debugger namespace.

Class ChromeDebugger

Fields
onDetach: Stream
onEvent: Stream
Getters and Setters
onDetach: Stream<dynamic>
onEvent: Stream<dynamic>
Methods
attach(dynamic target, String requiredVersion): Future<dynamic>
detach(dynamic target): Future<dynamic>
getTargets(): Future<dynamic>
sendCommand(dynamic target, String method, dynamic commandParams): Future<dynamic>

Fields

final Stream onDetach
final Stream onEvent

Getters and Setters

Stream<dynamic> get onDetach

Fired when browser terminates debugging session for the tab. This happens when either the tab is being closed or Chrome DevTools is being invoked for the attached tab.

Stream<dynamic> get onEvent

Fired whenever debugging target issues instrumentation event.

Methods

Future<dynamic> attach(dynamic target, String requiredVersion)

Attaches debugger to the given target.

target Debugging target to which you want to attach.

requiredVersion Required debugging protocol version ("0.1"). One can only attach to the debuggee with matching major version and greater or equal minor version. List of the protocol versions can be obtained here(http://code.google.com/chrome/devtools/docs/remote-debugging.html).

Future<dynamic> detach(dynamic target)

Detaches debugger from the given target.

target Debugging target from which you want to detach.

Future<dynamic> getTargets()

Returns the list of available debug targets.

Returns: Array of TargetInfo objects corresponding to the available debug targets.

Future<dynamic> sendCommand(dynamic target, String method, dynamic commandParams)

Sends given command to the debugging target.

target Debugging target to which you want to send the command.

method Method name. Should be one of the methods defined by the [remote debugging protocol](http://code.google.com/chrome/devtools/docs/remote-debugging.html).

commandParams JSON object with request parameters. This object must conform to the remote debugging params scheme for given method.

Returns: JSON object with the response. Structure of the response varies depending on the method and is defined by the remote debugging protocol.

Class Debuggee extends ChromeObject

Constructors
Debuggee(JsObject proxy)

Debuggee identifier. Either tabId or extensionId must be specified

Constructors

Debuggee(JsObject proxy)

Class TargetInfo extends ChromeObject

Constructors
